content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, sine x, times e raised to the negative x power " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, the negative of the fraction pi over 2, comma the fraction pi over 2, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which of the following open intervals is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> increasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the negative of the fraction pi over 4, comma the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the fraction pi over 4, comma the fraction pi over 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="open parenthesis, the negative of the fraction pi over 2, comma the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, the negative of the fraction pi over 2, comma the fraction pi over 4, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
